intro: Calandrinia polypetala, commonly known as the polypetalum or desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy foliage and deep root systems to conserve water. Its flowers bloom in the early morning, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Calandrinia polypetala is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
